Class Inventory

  • java.lang.Object
    • Inventory
  • public class Inventory
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents an inventory management system for electronic devices. It maintains a list of different types of devices and provides functionalities to add, remove, update, and display devices, as well as calculate total inventory value and export inventory reports.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Inventory()
      Constructs a new Inventory object with an empty inventory list.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      void addDevice​(IDevice device)
      Adds a new device to the inventory.
      double calculateTotalInventory()
      Calculates the total value of all devices in the inventory.
      void deviceWithMinPrice()
      Finds and displays the device with the minimum price in the inventory.
      void displayDevices()
      Displays all devices in the inventory.
      void exportInventoryReport()
      Exports an inventory report to a text file.
      void printTotalInventory()
      Prints the total value of all devices in the inventory.
      void removeDevice​(java.lang.String name)
      Removes a device from the inventory based on its name.
      void restockingDevice​(java.lang.String name, int quantity, java.lang.String condition)
      Restocks or reduces the quantity of a device in the inventory based on the condition.
      void sortDevicesByPrice()
      Sorts and displays all devices in the inventory by price.
      void updateDevice​(java.lang.String name, double price)
      Updates the price of a device in the inventory.

      Updates the quantity of a device in the inventory.
      void updateDevice​(java.lang.String name, int quantity, double price)
      Updates the quantity and/or price of a device in the inventory.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Inventory

        public Inventory()
        Constructs a new Inventory object with an empty inventory list. The inventory list is initialized with slots for different categories of devices.

    • Method Detail

      • addDevice

        public void addDevice​(IDevice device)
               throws java.lang.Exception
        Adds a new device to the inventory. Time complexity: O(n^2) (worst case)
        Parameters:
        device - The device to be added.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the device type is unsupported.

      • removeDevice

        public void removeDevice​(java.lang.String name)
                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Removes a device from the inventory based on its name. Time complexity: O(n^2)
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the device to be removed.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the device cannot be found.

      • restockingDevice

        public void restockingDevice​(java.lang.String name,
                             int quantity,
                             java.lang.String condition)
                      throws java.lang.Exception
        Restocks or reduces the quantity of a device in the inventory based on the condition. Time complexity: O(n^2)
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the device.
        quantity - The quantity to be added or removed.
        condition - The condition indicating whether to add or remove quantity.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the device cannot be found or the quantity is higher than the stock.

      • updateDevice

        public void updateDevice​(java.lang.String name,
                         int quantity,
                         double price)
                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Updates the quantity and/or price of a device in the inventory. findItem O(n^2) so Time complexity: O(n^2)
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the device.
        quantity - The new quantity to set.
        price - The new price to set.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the device cannot be found.

      • updateDevice

        public void updateDevice​(java.lang.String name,
                         int quantity)
                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Updates the quantity of a device in the inventory. findItem O(n^2) so Time complexity: O(n^2)
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the device.
        quantity - The new quantity to set.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the device cannot be found.

      • updateDevice

        public void updateDevice​(java.lang.String name,
                         double price)
                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Updates the price of a device in the inventory. findItem O(n^2) so Time complexity: O(n^2)
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the device.
        price - The new price to set.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the device cannot be found.

      • displayDevices

        public void displayDevices()
                    throws java.lang.Exception
        Displays all devices in the inventory. Time complexity: O(n^2)
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if there are no devices in the inventory.

      • deviceWithMinPrice

        public void deviceWithMinPrice()
                        throws java.lang.Exception
        Finds and displays the device with the minimum price in the inventory. Time complexity: O(n^2)
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if there are no devices in the inventory.

      • sortDevicesByPrice

        public void sortDevicesByPrice()
                        throws java.lang.Exception
        Sorts and displays all devices in the inventory by price. Time complexity: O(n^2)
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if there are no devices in the inventory.

      • calculateTotalInventory

        public double calculateTotalInventory()
        Calculates the total value of all devices in the inventory. Time complexity: O(n^2)
        Returns:
        The total inventory value.

      • printTotalInventory

        public void printTotalInventory()
        Prints the total value of all devices in the inventory. Time complexity: O(n^2) it calls calculate total inventory.

      • exportInventoryReport

        public void exportInventoryReport()
        Exports an inventory report to a text file. Time complexity: O(n^2)
